fig.label: Fig. 6.3

caption.p: There is prominent mid-zonal necrosis (between arrows) with many apoptotic hepatocytes and scattered lymphocytes. The portal tract at lower right is mildly inflamed and there is relative preservation of periportal parenchyma. Inset: The numerous apoptotic (Councilman) bodies present (arrows) are characteristic of liver involvement in yellow fever.
